text.p: Engineering consultancy Heidemij said on Tuesday it had acquired Chilean engineering consultancy Geotecnica Consultores.
"Heidemij has agreed to buy 67 percent of the shares of Geotecnica Consultores SA in Chili," the company said in a statement accompanying its 1996 results.

It said Geotecnica Consultores was one of Chile's biggest engineering consultancies, active in environmental, infrastructural and geotechnical work. The firm also operated in Peru, Argentina and Bolivia.
It has an annual turnover of some us$ 9 million and employs 150 people.
"The deal means a significant broadening of the services Heidemij offers in Latin America," Heidemij said.
It said the Chilean consultancy would cooperate with other Heidemij subsidiaries.
These would include Heidemij's Euroconsult, which had been active in rural and urban development projects in Latin America for many decades.
It said Geotecnica would also help in advising Heidemij's U.S. clients investing in Latin America.
